title.narrative: Improving the well-being of older people, their families and their communities in Asia, through resilient and self-sustaining community based organisations and improved social protection

description.narrative: At least 6 key INGO/NGOs to implement new community-led development models inclusive of older people in the 4 focus countries of Bangladesh, Indonesia, Cambodia and China.

This project will build on learning from the previous project in order to address the following challenges; a) the need to better understand the key variables affecting the development of sustainable, cost effective and replicable OPA/CBO models, b) lack of resources to pilot and develop effective OPA/CBO buy in from target countries, c) the need to continue to push for better social pensions schemes as one of the most effective ways to reduce poverty among older people, and d) insufficient opportunities for cross learning and sharing.
To improve social pension policy and practice by moving towards universal coverage and increased social pension benefits in East Asian Region
To increase the number of CBOs/NGOs, government and donors utilising and replicating multifunctional Older Person's Associations (OPAs) for community led development in the East Asia region
